name: Glassmarsh
role_in_state: specialized supplier of ritual materials and coastal craft fittings
economy_niches: harvested reed & peat for ritual wicks/fuel
salt pans and tidal salt extraction
processing of shoreline detritus for augury components
maintenance/repair services for small coastal craft
culture_adjustments: Coastal Tongues dialect heavy in mirror/glass metaphors
guild secrecy: kiln masters control trade and apprenticeships
seasonal 'mirror-tide' customs tied to glassmaking cycles
practical fatalism toward tidal loss; emphasis on salvage rights
constraints: scarce inland timber for kiln fuel
ritual reagents costly and often imported
no high-pressure steam tech for industrial kilns
notes: kiln-masters form quasi-guild clergy for augury-related production
glass fragments commonly used as votive offerings and divinatory tools
